intro: Nasa longivalvis, commonly known as the long-stemmed nasa, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its elongated, cylindrical stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Nasa longivalvis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to thrive in humid, warm climates.
